resource.name: state
resource.keywords: resource, state observed, state type, state

purpose.p: The state_type_schema identifies a type of state by specifying the criteria that shall be satisified for something to be in a state of that type.
purpose.example: A state is defined by the presence of an identified fault in a product.
purpose.p:
The state_observed_schema identifies an observed state and the link to the thing or things that are in the state.
Observed states may correspond to a period in the life of product data when the criteria defining the state type either have been satisfied, are being satisfied, or will be satisfied. States are not limited to products but may apply to activities, people, and organizations.
An observed state records that one or more items were in a defined for a period of their life. The item to which an observed state applies is determined by using . An observed state may apply to products, activities, people, organizations or to other items of interest, as defined by Application Protocols or Modules that use this resource part.

inscope.li: definition of what is needed for a state to exist;
relationship between two or more states;
assignment of a state to items;

outscope.li: those items to which state may be assigned, such as products, activities, people or organizations.

definition.def: a mode of being. All possible states of an item are types of state, which are identified as a specific in state_type_schema. As an item is realized or observed to enter any one of the s, the item acquires an individual state or in state_observed_schema.

schema.name: state_type_schema
schema.introduction: The state_type_schema represents the existence of possible states or types of state that an individual item may acquire.

fund_cons.p: A identifies a set of recognisable characteristics that can be used to distinguish an observed state. These characteristics specify a mode of being. When these characteristics are present for an item, the item is said to be in that state, as represented using .
fund_cons.note: An item may exhibit characteristics that match several s for a period of time.
fund_cons.p: In this part of ISO 10303 such a state type is recorded as an instance of the entity.

State types may be specified that are composed of multiple sub-state types. A may be related to another by a cause and effect relationship, where one causes or results from another. State types may also be related as a sequence, through which one may transition into another . The nature of the relationship between two s is defined by the role and description attributes of the entity.
Data recording the predicted or observed existence of an item in a state are the subject of the state_observed_schema.

schema.name: state_observed_schema
schema.introduction: The state_observed_schema represents the existence of state(s) an individual item is observed to possess at any point in time.

fund_cons.p: A entity represents the existence of recognisable characteristics for a period of time. The period of time may historical, current, or predicted. The characteristics that describe an observed state may be recorded in the description attribute of the entity, or by reference to relevant s using the entity.

Over time, a given observed state may be associated with multiple state types. This reflects the diagnosis process where something may be observed or predicted to be in an abnormal state before the precise cause, and hence , is known. A may be assessed initially using the entity. As investigations proceed other, more precise, s can be associated as asserted states again using the entity. Other s can be asserted as not applying.
An observed state may have occured, may be current, or may be expected to take place in the future.
An item or a set of items may exist in a state. This fact is captured by using the entity data type.
fund_cons.note: The assignment of state to an item or set of items may be meaningful for some process.
